statements: Effective policing should aim to protect public safety while upholding civil rights, recognizing that communities want both security and fair treatment. A balanced approach pairs focused, evidence-based enforcement on serious harm with strong safeguards—clear use-of-force standards, de-escalation training, unbiased practices, and transparent accountability. Building trust through community partnership, data-driven evaluation, and independent oversight can reduce crime and misconduct, ensuring police actions are both effective and legitimate.
